section.title: Troubleshooting Tips

p.b: Change needed to baremetalConfig.yml file needed after the Cobbler deploy

section.p: If you've made a mistake or wish to change your baremetalConfig.yml configuration file after you've already run the cobbler-deploy.yml playbook, follow these steps to ensure Cobbler gets updated with the new server information:

ol.li: Ensure your baremetalConfig.yml file is updated
Commit your changes to git: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "My config or other commit message"
Remove the nodes that had the old information from Cobbler using: cobbler system remove --name <nodename>

Re-run the cobbler-deploy.yml and bm-reimage.yml ansible scripts to upload the new node definitions to Cobbler and image the nodes: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost cobbler-deploy.yml ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost bm-reimage.yml
